page.title: 03FISHERMANS WALK
page.content: Fisherrow is on the west side of the River Esk. Fisherrow was once a great centre of the herring industry. The fishermen in Fisherrow are still active today even although their boats are berthed in different harbours. Fisherrow is best known though for its annual Fishermans Walk. They celebrate this walk at the end of what is meant to be the end of the herring season. The fishermen wear an apron over a puffed skirt which is called a coat. Then there is a blouse which is called a shargoon, then a brightly coloured shawl. The walk starts at the Coast Mission down by Fisherrow Links, then the walk progresses through the town to Pinkie Playing Fields where they have sports and fun. They return to the Coast Mission in the evening, then a dance.
